channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. cannabis shoppers face a market flush with illegal weed
item.description: In much of the U.S., illegal cannabis outcompetes legal weed sold in licensed shops. For consumers, it can be difficult to find regulated cannabis — but there are tips on how to do that.
item.content:encoded:
In much of the U.S., illegal cannabis outcompetes legal weed sold in licensed shops. For consumers, it can be difficult to find regulated cannabis — but there are tips on how to do that.

(Image credit: Maggie Andresen for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Trump's proposal for the Gaza Strip. And, what corporations got wrong about DEI
item.description: President Trump announced that he wants the U.S. to take over the Gaza Strip. And, some DEI experts say Trump's attacks on diversity-in-business programs may be the wakeup call big companies need.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump announced that he wants the U.S. to take over the Gaza Strip. And, some DEI experts say Trump's attacks on diversity-in-business programs may be the wakeup call big companies need.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Trump says the U.S. will 'take over' Gaza and relocate its people. What does it mean?
item.description: It wasn't immediately clear what legal authority Trump would have to execute his proposal, and they would likely be met by fierce resistance from Palestinians and from regional Arab countries.
item.content:encoded:
It wasn't immediately clear what legal authority Trump would have to execute his proposal, and they would likely be met by fierce resistance from Palestinians and from regional Arab countries.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Trump picks Neil Jacobs to head NOAA, a scientist with 'Sharpiegate' ties
item.description: President Trump has nominated Neil Jacobs to head NOAA. Some former NOAA employees are concerned about Jacobs' scientific integrity after his prior involvement in "Sharpiegate."
item.content:encoded:
President Trump has nominated Neil Jacobs to head NOAA. Some former NOAA employees are concerned about Jacobs' scientific integrity after his prior involvement in "Sharpiegate."

(Image credit: Win McNamee/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda

item.title: Homeland Security's workforce might not be as big as Trump's immigration goals
item.description: Changes to hiring and retention practices grew the department by 19,000 people in four years. But former officials warn that's still not enough for Trump's ambitious policy goals.
item.content:encoded:
Changes to hiring and retention practices grew the department by 19,000 people in four years. But former officials warn that's still not enough for Trump's ambitious policy goals.

(Image credit: John Moore)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Here's how Trump's tariffs could impact you and your wallet
item.description: Tariffs are now in effect on goods from China, and imports from Canada and Mexico could be next (again). Americans are likely to see higher prices on a wide variety of products as a result.
item.content:encoded:
Tariffs are now in effect on goods from China, and imports from Canada and Mexico could be next (again). Americans are likely to see higher prices on a wide variety of products as a result.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Laurel Wamsley

item.title: Republicans in Congress mostly shrug as Musk and DOGE set sights on spending
item.description: Congress controls the power of the purse, but Republicans on Capitol Hill have put up little resistance to efforts by the administration to suspend spending that they've already approved.
item.content:encoded:
Congress controls the power of the purse, but Republicans on Capitol Hill have put up little resistance to efforts by the administration to suspend spending that they've already approved.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Deirdre Walsh

item.title: 'We do not exist anymore': New prison rules ban female clothing for trans women
item.description: As federal lawsuits challenge President Trump's executive order impacting trans inmates, the Bureau of Prisons is starting to roll out new policies demanding trans women hand over female-identifying clothing and other items.
item.content:encoded:
As federal lawsuits challenge President Trump's executive order impacting trans inmates, the Bureau of Prisons is starting to roll out new policies demanding trans women hand over female-identifying clothing and other items.

(Image credit: Mark Lennihan)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: A Stradivarius violin could sell for a record sum at auction. Is it worth the hype?
item.description: Stradivarius violins often sell for millions. There's a long history behind them, and violinists who swear they sound better than modern ones.
item.content:encoded:
Stradivarius violins often sell for millions. There's a long history behind them, and violinists who swear they sound better than modern ones.

(Image credit: Angela Weiss)
item.dc:creator: James Doubek

item.title: Philippine vice president impeached by House, faces Senate trial
item.description: Sara Duterte, the daughter of former President Rodrigo Duterte, has faced at least four impeachment complaints by several legislators and left-wing activist groups over a range of issues.
item.content:encoded:
Sara Duterte, the daughter of former President Rodrigo Duterte, has faced at least four impeachment complaints by several legislators and left-wing activist groups over a range of issues.

(Image credit: Aaron Favila)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
